action: I want to securely and centrally manage contracts with business partners
reason: To prevent legal risks caused by overlooked contract details or expired deadlines
acceptance_criteria: Contract registration is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with contract management permissions can perform registration, updates, and deletion.
Contract IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
The contract title is a mandatory input.
Contract types (Outsourcing, NDA, Sales Contract, etc.) are managed via a selectable list.
Linking with a business partner company ID is mandatory.
Date format checks are performed for contract start and end dates.
Registration fails if the end date is before the start date.
Uploading contract files in PDF or Word format is possible.
Files with non-permitted extensions cannot be uploaded.
Files are stored only after passing a virus scan.
Files are stored in encrypted storage.
File access is controlled via signed URLs.
Contract metadata is stored in UTF-8 encoding.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
The version number is automatically incremented upon contract renewal.
Old versions of contracts are retained as history.
Contract deletion is implemented as a logical delete.
Deletion is only possible by the Administrator role.
Audit logs are stored upon deletion.
Contract viewing history is recorded.
Viewing logs include user_id, timestamp, and IP address.
Automatic alert notifications are generated 30 days before contract expiration.
Notifications are processed via asynchronous queues.
The status is automatically updated when a contract expires.
Status is restricted to Active / Expired / Terminated.
Invalid status value updates will fail.
The same validation applies to registration via API.
Contract searching supports full-text search.
Search results are filtered according to user permissions.
Internal file paths are not included in the response.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Registration processes are completed within a DB transaction.
Concurrent updates trigger conflict detection via optimistic locking.
Change history stores values before and after updates.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Internal information is not returned during errors.
Periodic backups of contract data are executed.
Backup data is also encrypted.
Communication is mandatory via HTTPS.
Operation log retention periods are configurable.
Permission checks are performed when exporting contract information.
Masking rules are applied during CSV/PDF export.
